net.cloud.server.logging

Class LogWriterSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.logging.LogWriterSet

  • public class LogWriterSet
extends Object
    A collection of PrintWriters to be used for writing to log files, where each PrintWriter is associated with a different LogSection.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private EnumMap<LogSection,Optional<PrintWriter>> writers
      The PrintWriters are stored in a map.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LogWriterSet()
      Create a new LogWriterSet.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeWriters()
      Close all of the PrintWriters held in this set
      private void fillMap()
      For every LogSection, a PrintWriter to a specific log file will be opened and placed into the map.
      void flushWriters()
      Flush out all of the PrintWriters held in this set
      Optional<PrintWriter> getWriter(LogSection section)
      Obtain the PrintWriter associated with the log file for the given section.
      private void placeWriterInMap(LogSection section)
      In an attempt to break things into methods more (such a basic skill, I know...) Here we go, a method to get a PrintWriter and place it into the map

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • writers

        private EnumMap<LogSection,Optional<PrintWriter>> writers
        The PrintWriters are stored in a map. Because EnumMaps are cool.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogWriterSet

        public LogWriterSet()
        Create a new LogWriterSet. It will also initialize PrintWriters within the set. There will be a PrintWriter for each LogSection value except STD_OUT (which is written to differently)

    • Method Detail

      • getWriter

        public Optional<PrintWriter> getWriter(LogSection section)
        Obtain the PrintWriter associated with the log file for the given section. On the chance the Writer could not be created, the Optional will be empty. Comes as an Optional for easy null-checking.
        Parameters:
        section - The kind of log to get a writer to
        Returns:
        A PrintWriter to the requested log file wrapped in an Optional

      • flushWriters

        public void flushWriters()
        Flush out all of the PrintWriters held in this set

      • closeWriters

        public void closeWriters()
        Close all of the PrintWriters held in this set

      • fillMap

        private void fillMap()
        For every LogSection, a PrintWriter to a specific log file will be opened and placed into the map. When the file can't be opened, the value will be an empty Optional.

      • placeWriterInMap

        private void placeWriterInMap(LogSection section)
        In an attempt to break things into methods more (such a basic skill, I know...) Here we go, a method to get a PrintWriter and place it into the map
        Parameters:
        section - The LogSection to obtain a PrintWriter for
